definition: lit. draw legs on a snake (idiom); fig. to ruin the effect by adding sth superfluous/to overdo it
to draw/picture/painting/CL:幅[fu2],張|张[zhang1]/classifier for paintings etc/variant of 劃|划[hua4]
snake/serpent/CL:條|条[tiao2]
to add/to increase/to replenish
excessive
foot/to be sufficient/ample

sentences.english: Comment upon this would be to paint the lily.
sentences.chinese: 對此發表評論無異於畫蛇添足。

sentences.english: For such a beautiful girl to use make-up would be to gild the lily.
sentences.chinese: 對一個這樣漂亮的女孩來說，化妝簡直就是畫蛇添足。

sentences.english: Whatkind of painting should the propeller use?
sentences.chinese: 螺旋槳噴漆真的是畫蛇添足嗎？

sentences.english: That’s the story of "Draw a snake and add feet to it."
sentences.chinese: 這就是“畫蛇添足”的故事。

sentences.english: The man who added a feet for the snake had not drank the wine.
sentences.chinese: 可以回答，最後那個畫蛇添足的人沒喝到酒。

definition: sequel/continuation of a book
lit. to scratch the outside of the boot (idiom)/fig. beside the point/ineffectual
to mention sth without elaborating (idiom); not giving details
to combine words/word formation
lit. to put Zhang's hat on Li's head/to attribute sth to the wrong person (idiom)/to confuse one thing with another
forged book/book of dubious authenticity/misattributed book/Apocrypha
hard to tell if it's real or sham
to make an irrelevant comparison or interpretation (idiom)
subject
lit. trifling destroys the will (idiom); infatuation with fine details prevents one making progress/excessive attention to trivia saps the will
lit. chasing the wind and clutching at shadows (idiom); fig. groundless accusations/to act on hearsay evidence
to shoot without aim (idiom); fig. to speak without thinking/firing blindly/to shoot in the air/a shot in the dark
making a deer out to be a horse (idiom); deliberate misrepresentation
brush stroke to the side (calligraphy)/fig. side stroke/lateral thinking
irreverent
to overcorrect (idiom)/to overcompensate
